content.question: Doxycycline is a drug used to treat malaria and some bacterial infections. Doxycycline binds to the prokaryotic 30S ribosomal subunit and inhibits its function. Explain how doxycycline can be an effective treatment for a P. falciparum infection in humans.

frqParts.text: Doxycycline is a drug used to treat malaria and some bacterial infections. Doxycycline binds to the prokaryotic 30S ribosomal subunit and inhibits its function. Explain how doxycycline can be an effective treatment for a P. falciparum infection in humans.

skill.text: 6.D: Explain the relationship between experimental results and larger biological concepts, processes, or theories.
